activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Camaro Anthony Aldridge

records.addlTxt:
10:17 AM Defendant Camaro Anthony Aldridge appeared by video.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank appeared by video for Camaro Anthony Aldridge.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank speaks that the waiver of preliminary hearing has been filed. Court goes over the waiver with CS. Court binds over for trial. Attorney Forehand has filed an information bring forth the same charges that are contained in the criminal complaint. Attorney Frank waives the formal reading and stands mute. CA concurs. Max penalties stated. Court speaks to CA and informs him that he needs to make arrangements to be here in the courtroom on the next hearing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Judge approved defendant's request to appear remotely. Must appear by Zoom video.
to Appear by Zoom for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing
Email from Camaro Aldridge requesting to appear by phone

1:39 PM Defendant Camaro Anthony Aldridge appeared by video.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Camaro Anthony Aldridge.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank states that the complaint has been mail to CA. Attorney Frank asks for a reset for after his client receives the complaint. Max penalties stated. CA waives the time limit for the preliminary hearing. Court expects CA to be in person for the preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Judge approved the defendant appear by Zoom on 8/17 only.

2:56 PM Defendant Camaro Aldridge appeared by video. Attorney Harper appears for the State. Attorney Erickson appears by video.

State asks for $2,500 signature bond
No contact H.L.D (DOB 5/27/07) or residence.
No contact with Bancroft trailer Park

Attorney Erickson doesn't object to a signature bond.
CA comments about no contact with the trailer park.

Court orders:
$2,500 signature bond
No contact H.L.D (DOB 5/27/07) or residence.
No contact with Bancroft trailer Park.

Attorney Harper speaks about property that may needs to be pick up then he may go with law enforcement once.

Initial set for August 17, 2022 at 1:30 PM
